definition: (Chinese linguistics) zero initial (the initial of a syllable that does not begin with a consonant)

zero/nought/zero sign/fractional/fragmentary/odd (of numbers)/(placed between two numbers to indicate a smaller quantity followed by a larger one)/fraction/(in mathematics) remainder (after division)/extra/to wither and fall/to wither
sound/voice/tone/noise/reputation/classifier for sounds
mother/elderly female relative/origin/source/(of animals) female
the final of a Chinese syllable (the component of a syllable remaining after removal of the initial consonant, if any, and the tone, e.g. the final of "niáng" is "iang")
consonant/the initial consonant (of a Chinese syllable)
(phonology) coda, the part of a syllable that follows its vocalic nucleus (e.g. "u" in kòu or "n" in běn)
main vowel in diphthong
simple finals
alveolar/consonants z, c, s produced with the tip of the tongue on the alveolar ridge
entering tone/checked tone/one of the four tones of Middle Chinese
alveolar/consonants z, c, s produced with the tip of the tongue on the alveolar ridge
consonant
evenly rising tone, the second tone of putonghua
falling tone/fourth tone in modern Mandarin
retroflex sound (e.g. in Mandarin zh, ch, sh, r)
(of Chinese pronunciation) a vowel followed by a nasal consonant
leading vowel of diphthong
alveolar nasal/consonant n produced in the nose with the tongue against the alveolar ridge
retroflex sound (e.g. in Mandarin zh, ch, sh, r)
